Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired partly brown) with single added white band; exterior reserved save for frieze of concentric circles between bands in handle zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burned during the bombings in London in 1941. Although Lemos does not discuss this sherd, it belongs in the Group of Chalices with Dotted Concentric Circles because of the decoration around the handle zone and between the handles (Lemos 1991, 70). For other examples, see British Museum 1888,0601.478.j and 1888,0601.478.i.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0216) (phase 2)
